attributes.action: Make Harry Redknapp England manager now
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Harry Redknapp has a proven record of achieving at the top level, playing attractive and effective football.

He is a staunch advocate of developing youth and is responsible for the likes of Frank Lampard, Rio Ferdinand, Joe Cole, Jermaine Defoe and Michael Carrick to name a few.

Graduating from the West Ham academy, he knows better than most the values and expectations of English football.

His nationality seems to preclude him from the top club jobs in England - but it should be a distinct advantage when it comes to national job.

He should have been given the job before Sven-Goran Eriksson was appointed, and again when Steve McClaren succeeded the Swede.

Now is the time to rectify the catalogue of errors made ever since Glenn Hoddle was dismissed.

It is time to get a manager the public can empathise with and can meet the expectations of the nation.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
